doc.title: Horizon Robotics
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/Horizon Robotics Raise PO on improving growth outlook Mgmt meeting takeawaysHorizon Robotics Raise PO on improving growt_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 11.10 HKD | Price: 9.11 HKD

We hosted the post- results investor meeting (in- person) for Horizon Robotics mgmt. on 28 Aug (Thu) and turned more positive on its future growth outlook given recent smooth design- in of car models in both domestic and overseas market. Horizon has increased the no. of new car model design- win to nearly 400 in 1H25 from over 310 by FY24. We believe Horizon could achieve design win for their high- end HSD solutions from at least 4- 5 automakers this year, which will boost its shipment of J6P to 430k units in 2026E from 40k in 2025E, per our forecasts.

In FY26E, mgmt. expects further share gain among domestic auto OEMs for intelligent assisted driving solutions (1H25 market share: \(32.4\%\) ). In addition, Horizon is expected to gradually capture share in China's JV automakers market, thanks to its 30 new car model design- win from leading vendors such as Volkswagen, per mgmt. Mgmt. sees accelerated penetration of more advanced autonomous driving functions (i.e., highway NOA / city NOA) in lower- priced vehicle segments, bringing growth opportunities for Horizon's mid- to- high- end autonomous driving chips. Overall, we expect 34% YoY chip shipment growth for Horizon in FY26E reaching 5.5mn, within which around 63% would be mid- to- high end products (J5/J6 series) vs. current percentage at \(\sim 50\%\) .

GPM for automotive product solutions segment (i.e., autonomous driving chip & software) reached 45.6% in 1H25, up 3.9ppts YoY, which could see further improvement thanks to higher rev mix of mid- to- high end products. Due to more spending on cloud computing, we expect higher R&D expenses at \(\sim \text{Rmb} 4.5bn\) in FY25E (+43% YoY).

We raise our FY26- 27E revenue forecasts by \(3 - 5\%\) to factor in better progress of new vehicle model design- win with mass shipment starting from FY26E, while slightly trimming FY25E revenue forecast by \(2\%\) to reflect weaker- than- expected demand from certain auto OEM clients in 2H25E, Rolling over valuation, our PO is adjusted to HKS11.1 (from HK9.3) based on a 50/50 blend of P/S and DCF. Reiterate Buy.
\\* For full definitions of Qmethod means, see page 7.

>> Employed by a non- US affiliate of BofAS and is not registered/qualified as a research analyst under the FINRA rules. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Refer to important disclosures on page 8 to 10. Analyst Certification on page 6. Price Objective Basis/Risk on page 6.

Company DescriptionHorizon Robotics is a leading advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) and autonomous driving (AD) solutions provider for passenger vehicles. Its solutions combine algorithms, purpose-built software and processing hardware. In 2024, Horizon Robotics had 34% share of LO to L2+ autonomous driving solutions and ranked No.3 as a third-party AD chip suppliers of L2+ & above solutions among Chinese OEMs by vehicle volume.

We have a Buy rating on Horizon Robotics, given: 1) secular growth of autonomous driving SoC market, 2) leading market position, and 3) promising share gain opportunity in China. Besides, we believe expansion into non- automotive market could be the second growth engine in the long term.

Estimates and PO changeIn view of promising rev growth outlook, we raise our FY26- 27E revenue forecasts by 3- 5% to factor in better progress of new vehicle model design within mass shipment starting from FY26E, while slight trimming our FY25E revenue forecast by 2% to reflect weaker- than- expected demand from certain auto OEM clients in 2H25E. In addition, we lower our FY25- 27E adjusted net profit estimates mainly due to more R&D spending for cloud computing. Rolling over valuation, our PO is adjusted to HK\(11.1 based on a 50/50 blend of P/S and DCF to reflect near- term growth and long- term outlook. Our P/S based value is HK\)10.4, based on 22x 12- mth FwP/S (unchanged). Our DCF based valuation is HK\)11.8, applying 10.7% WACC (2.5% risk- free rate, 8% market risk premium, and 1.2x beta), and 3% terminal growth rate. We also assume HKSCNY FX rate at 0.91.
Exhibit 1:Horizon Robotics:Estimates revision
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 2:Horizon Robotics-Semi-annual results Total revenue for Horizon Robotics in 1H25 increased 68% YoY to Rmb1.57bn
Source: Company, BofA Global Research
Our blended valuation results in our PO of HK$11.1

Our PO of HK\$11.1 is based on a 50/50 blend of P/S and DCF to reflect near- term growth and long- term outlook. We choose the P/S valuation metric because Horizon Robotics is rapidly growing its revenue while it is still loss- making before breakeven from FY27E, rendering P/E inappropriate. Our P/S based value is HK\$10.4, based on 22x 12- month forward P/S. Our multiple of 22x is in- line with the market cap weighted average P/S of Horizon Robotics' China peers (major AI Chip / ADAS SoC chip vendors) given that we expect the company to post comparable FY24- 27E revenue CAGR of \(60\%\) vs. peers.

Our DCF based valuation is HK\$11.8, applying \(10.7\%\) WACC (2.5% risk- free rate, \(8\%\) market risk premium, and 1.2x beta), and \(3\%\) terminal growth rate. We also assume HKD/CNY FX rate at 0.91.
Upside risks: 1) more orders win from auto OEM especially the foreign brand, 2) earlier- than- expected roll- out of more advanced solutions (with J6P), 3) earlier- than- expected breakeven.

Downside risks: 1) slower- than- expected ADAS/AD penetration in China, 2) stiff competition, 3) supply chain bottleneck, and 4) a higher proportion of OEMs/ Tier- 1 suppliers with in- house solution development.

Qmethod is the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and validations. The key features of Qmethod are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls. Qtobase is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts' earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research.
